perturbation.original_text: 11.2	Any dispute, conflict or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the performance hereof shall be resolved by the Parties through amicable negotiation, which negotiation shall commence immediately upon notice by one Party to the other of the nature of such dispute, conflict or claim. In the event that such dispute is not resolved within thirty (30) Business Days following such notice, either Party may upon the expiration of the such 30-day notice period submit such dispute to arbitration by the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre in accordance with the arbitration rules of such centre then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted in Hong Kong in English and the arbitral award shall be binding upon both Parties. During the resolution (including the arbitration) of the dispute, the Parties shall continue to perform other portions of this Agreement unaffected by such dispute.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.2	Any dispute, conflict or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the performance hereof shall be resolved by the Parties through amicable negotiation, which negotiation shall commence immediately upon notice by one Party to the other of the nature of such dispute, conflict or claim. In the event that such dispute is not resolved within fifteen (15) Business Days following such notice, either Party may upon the expiration of the such 15-day notice period submit such dispute to arbitration by the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre in accordance with the arbitration rules of such centre then in effect. The arbitration shall be conducted in Hong Kong in English and the arbitral award shall be binding upon both Parties. During the resolution (including the arbitration) of the dispute, the Parties shall continue to perform other portions of this Agreement unaffected by such dispute.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the negotiation period from 30 to 15 business days creates a direct contradiction regarding the time allotted for amicable negotiation before arbitration can be initiated. This introduces uncertainty as to when a party can legitimately move to arbitration, potentially leading to disputes over whether the negotiation period was adequately exhausted.
perturbation.location: ARTICLE ELEVEN APPLICABLE LAW; DISPUTE RESOLUTION

perturbation.original_text: 9.1	This Agreement shall become effective on the date on which it is signed and affixed with the corporate seals by the authorized representative of each Party and have a term of five (5) years commencing as of the effective date hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.1	This Agreement shall become effective on the date on which it is signed and affixed with the corporate seals by the authorized representative of each Party and have a term of three (3) years commencing as of the effective date hereof.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the term length of the agreement from 5 years to 3 creates a contradiction. The different lengths introduce uncertainty and potential disputes over the contract's expiration date, impacting renewal negotiations, termination rights, and long-term obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 13.4	Any and all notices, approvals, requests, authorizations, instructions or other communications required hereunder (collectively, “Written Documents”) shall be made in writing and with a reference to this Agreement. A Written Document shall be deemed duly given by one Party to the other upon personal delivery to the address of the other Party; or on a date which is four (4) business days from the date on which the Written Document is posted through registered or certified mail (postage prepaid and return receipt requested), regardless of whether the Written Document is actually received; or on the first business day following the date on which the Written Document is sent by express service (as indicated by the written receipt confirmation); or as indicated on the confirmation report of the fax machine confirming that the Written Document is delivered by fax successfully.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.4	Any and all notices, approvals, requests, authorizations, instructions or other communications required hereunder (collectively, “Written Documents”) shall be made in writing and with a reference to this Agreement. A Written Document shall be deemed duly given by one Party to the other upon personal delivery to the address of the other Party; or on a date which is ten (10) business days from the date on which the Written Document is posted through registered or certified mail (postage prepaid and return receipt requested), regardless of whether the Written Document is actually received; or on the first business day following the date on which the Written Document is sent by express service (as indicated by the written receipt confirmation); or as indicated on the confirmation report of the fax machine confirming that the Written Document is delivered by fax successfully.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the deemed delivery date for registered/certified mail from four to ten business days creates conflicting terms about when a written document is officially considered delivered. This inconsistency impacts deadlines, response times, and the overall enforceability of notice-related clauses within the agreement.
